type: Atmospheric Phenomenon
description: A mesocyclone is a vortex of air within a convective storm, and it can tighten and intensify to produce a tornado. name: mature stage
type: Tornado Stage
description: The mature stage of a tornado is characterized by a well-defined, rotating column of air extending from the cloud base to the ground. name: dissipation stage
type: Tornado Stage
description: The dissipation stage is the final stage of a tornado, where the vortex begins to weaken and eventually dissipate. name: EF0
type: Tornado Classification
description: EF0 is the weakest classification on the Enhanced Fujita (EF) scale for tornadoes, with wind speeds typically ranging from 65 to 85 mph and causing minor damage.
